Pre-Game Insights: Gambia have improved significantly over the last few years, but they face an Ivory Coast side in this one that are overflowing with talent.
While we are not expecting another 9-0 victory as they managed last week, we do still feel that the Elephants will claim a fairly comfortable win in this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ivory Coast were simply too strong in their opening match against Seychelles, with Karim Konate and Hamed Traore scoring two goals each, while Sebastian Haller, Jean-Philippe Krasso, Seko Fofana, Ibrahim Sangare and Simon Adingra each contributed one goal in the 9-0 onslaught.
The Elephants are now unbeaten in their last four matches in all competitions, including two wins and two draws, and are strongly fancied not just to win this match but to go on to top the group.
Gambia have arguably turned out their best-ever side in recent times and came into this competition with loads of confidence, having recently qualified for a third consecutive Africa Cup of Nations.
These two teams have faced each other six times in the past, with the Elephants claiming four wins and Gambia emerging victorious in two previous matches.
